results.title: Liquid Wind
results.creator_credit: Greg Battye, Peter Hellman and Holly North
results.brief_description: Liquid Wind takes learners from the very basics of sensing wind direction, rigging the board, sailing theory and techniques, and safety, to sailing in stronger winds and using a harness. The instruction is compatible with the ACABSI Elementary I syllabus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Battye, Peter Hellman and Holly North

results.title: Liquid sky
results.brief_description: A cult classic of the post-punk era, “Liquid Sky” is a bizarre and erotic subversion of the science-fiction film. Set in the New York New Wave fashion milieu, the story concerns a group of aliens that have landed upstairs from fashion model Margaret (Anne Carlisle). The aliens are in search of pure heroin which they need for their biological survival, but while on earth they become addicted to the chemicals secreted by the brain during orgasm. Margaret, who is pursued constantly by men and women, becomes the pivotal conduit for the space creatures’ addiction but, unfortunately for Margaret, the use the aliens make of her body results in the death of her lovers. Wickedly perverse in its delight in the rituals and pleasures of addiction, aptly identifying the paranoias and fears attached to sex with the onslaught of the AIDS epidemic, and cruelly bitchy about the New York art and fashion worlds, “Liquid Sky” is a visionary precursor to the New Queer Cinema of the 1990s. It is directed by Russian emigre director, Slava Tsukerman, and features an inventive original electronic music score by Tsukerman, Brenda Hutchinson and Clive Smith.

results.title: Liquid lore
results.brief_description: Begins by illustrating the value of water in our lives. Quickly turns to the adverse effects of alcohol on the human body. Examples of alcohol use in industry is shown, then reverts back to it’s consumption using propaganda techniques.

results.title: Lipstick on your collar
results.creator_credit: Rosemarie Whitman, Whistling Gypsy Production for Channel 4 and Renny Rye
results.brief_description: By acclaimed writer Dennis Potter, “Lipstick on your collar” is a romantic comedy which transports the viewer back to the 1950’s and the era of rock and roll. Mick Hopper, working in the War Office as part of his National Service, uses his imagination to escape the drudgery and bully boy officers. By transporting them into his fantasies as rock and roll singers he deals with the harshness of life. When Private Francis, a young Welshman joins Mick, they join forces. Often astonishing and never dull, “Lipstick on your collar” is a must for all Dennis Potter fans.

results.title: Lionheart [the Jesse Martin story] [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Phil Gregory, Lionheart Documentaries and Paul Currie
results.brief_description: Jesse Martin is a testament to living out your dreams. With little more than 3 hours solo sailing experience and having never sailed beyond Port Philip Bay, Jesse headed out of Sandringham on an 11 month journey to fulfil his dream of sailing single handed around the world. Featuring interviews with Jesse, his family, sailors, meteorologists, business advisors and friends - post journey, interspersed with live footage, Jesse explains what motivates him and how he sustained himself during the challenging experience.

results.title: Lionel Hampton and the golden men of jazz
results.brief_description: Live concert from the Munich Summer Piano Festival 1993, featuring Lionel Hampton & The Golden Men of Jazz, performing a dozen jazz tunes. The band are: Lionel Hampton (vibes, drums and vocals), Clark Terry (trumpet), Harry Sweats Edison (trumpet), Al Grey (trombone), Benny Golson (saxaphone), Junior Mance (piano), Jimmy Woody (bass), Panama Francis (drums). Songs include Hamp, Cool Vibes, Lester Leaps In, God Bless the child, Toin Me Loose, Paradise, How High the Moon, I Remember Clifford, Drum On In, Seven Come Eleven, Hey Baba Rebob and What a Wonderful World, A lively and vibrant performance from these jazz wonders.

results.title: Lion - tiger fight! (D)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventure parade”.
A pre World War II edited news/show-reel, a dramatic and adventurous expedition into the wild jungles of India. Mostly contrived and very little adherance to actual fact. The pith-helmeted hunters eventually capture a tiger and…a lion! They soberly watch on as the two cats fight to the death. NB: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB

results.title: Lion
results.creator_credit: John Downer, BBC and Discovery Channel
results.brief_description: A state-of-the-art remote-control camera disguised as a boulder is the innovative filming technique used to get filmmakers to the very heart of a pride of lions. For the first time a litter of cubs is filmed from the time they are introduced by the lionness to the rest of the pride at 6 weeks, covering almost 3,000 hours of growing time, until they are mature adults. Through this time David Attenborough discusses significant events in the development of the young lions that turn them from cubs into proficient hunters. This is a unique insight into the development of lions and the main discovery made is that every skill an adult lion has, every move it makes, is learned and practiced as a cub. Michael W. Richards and Geoffrey Bell are the main cinematographers who allow us to go where no camera has ever gone before.

results.title: Lintola: addition with carrying
results.creator_credit: Davidson Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

Episode of Series “Math that counts”.

results.title: Linnaeus
results.brief_description: The life of Linnaeus, the Swedish botanist, re-enacted against the Swedish landscape. His birthplace, studies at Uppsala University and the first journey to Lappland. Studies in Holland and first publication of the “Systema Naturae”. Its place in scientific history. His later work as a teacher and in making surveys of Sweden’s natural resources. The Linnaen museum. Includes many close-ups of Swedish flowers and animals.
